Germany: An assembly of East Frankish nobles at Trebur deposed Charles the Fat in favor of his nephew Arnulf of Carinthia.
Berengar I of Italy, the margrave of Friulu, was crowned king of Italy at Pavia by the Italian nobility.
Slovenia: Arnulf of Carinthia (850–899) a grandson of Louis the German assumes his title of King of the East Franks and becomes the first Duke of Carinthia.
